page.title: 15 Mammals of the area
page.content: Throughout the woods of the area are three different species of deer;fallow deer (a medium sized deer with a fawn coat with white spots.),roe deer and a small species introduced from the east, the muntjac. Red foxes have earths throughout the area and are attractive but shy mammals ,considered pests in the surrounding pheasant woods,and so are persecuted. Another mammal in the area is the badger,whose setts can be found nearby. Bats are small insectiverous mammals which fly at night and also have very advanced sonar which they use to track down insects.Greater horseshoe bats,pipistrelle bats and noctule bats are found throughout the area. Yellow necked mice,wood mice,bank voles,common voles,common shrews and pygmy shrews,represent the small rodents of the area.
